title: Permabanned after DC'ing one game
body: This account HAS been punished in the past, but I have completely reformed. I pretty much only play with friends now and NEVER talk in chat unless it's referring to strategy. My last game on this account, I ended up getting DC'd and just left for the night because I couldn't reconnect. I logged in after class today and was perma banned. I have received multiple honor check points since my last punishment and really think this is unfair. I have played hundreds of games without being toxic/leaving/etc. I believe the automatic system flagged me and perma banned me.

replies.body: Can we see your reform card please?
How can I show you that? It will not even let me into the client, just https://gyazo.com/2aa656a188903f36ef0e8722717c6284 . Didn't receive an e-mail or anything.

Not that I can tell. No password change e-mails or anything. My last game was the last game recorded (where I DC'd) and got on after class to this. :( I also checked to see if it was a chargeback issue or anything, and my balance was $0.00, so it wasn't that either.

That's what we were looking for. 

At first glance, it looks like a shield ban. Meaning someone tried to hack you and Riot locked the account to protect your account. 

Though it may not be the case, but support is your best bet. Which you've already done. So just wait patiently now.

> [{quoted}](name=TlNY MEAT GANG,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=XFRdeRr0,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-12-13T00:15:27.743+0000)
>
> How can I show you that? It will not even let me into the client, just https://gyazo.com/2aa656a188903f36ef0e8722717c6284 . Didn't receive an e-mail or anything.

In this case, you will need to send a [Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to Riot Support asking why you were punished.
I did a few hours ago, about how long does it take to respond?

> [{quoted}](name=TlNY MEAT GANG,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=XFRdeRr0,comment-id=0000000000010000,timestamp=2018-12-13T00:31:46.463+0000)
>
> I did a few hours ago, about how long does it take to respond?

The usual response time for Support Tickets is 24-48 hours but can change depending on the volume of tickets.

I don't know why it's a thing for banned players to focus on the last thing they were doing before they got banned. "Banned after one death?" "Banned after one DC?" "Banned after drinking a glass of orange juice?"

Anyway, the system doesn't forget or discard the previous punishments on your account. If you're approaching a permaban, you will be right on the edge of that permaban forever, and the next recidivation gets you a perma.

Well... to be fair, not forever, depending on your behavior, games played, and time passed since your last punishment.

> [{quoted}](name=Telephone Booth,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=XFRdeRr0,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-12-13T03:29:05.302+0000)
>
> Well... to be fair, not forever, depending on your behavior, games played, and time passed since your last punishment.

So, someone could get a 14-day, then be nice for a year or three, then rage out and get another 14-day, then be nice for another couple years, then another 14-day...? I don't think that's the case. At this time, the next punishment after a 14-day is a permaban. But feel free to test this.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=XFRdeRr0,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2018-12-13T05:36:30.720+0000)

Yes. Someone could. Infact, technically someone could get a 14 day, be nice for 3 years, and get a chat restrict even.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=XFRdeRr0,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2018-12-13T05:36:30.720+0000)

> So, someone could get a 14-day, then be nice for a year or three, then rage out and get another 14-day, then be nice for another couple years, then another 14-day...? I don't think that's the case. At this time, the next punishment after a 14-day is a permaban. But feel free to test this.

Punishment levels de-escalate if you show steps toward reform, i.e. a sufficient number of neutral/positive games.

And really, if there's a couple years (or longer, Riot is understandably intentionally vague about how long it takes to de-escalate a punishment tier) between behavior that escalates to a 14-day ban, is it that bad? At that point, it's so long between punishments you're hardly gaming the system.

And no, no one's likely to test this because it would take too long and more effort than it would be worth.

> [{quoted}](name=Vreivai,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=XFRdeRr0,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2018-12-13T05:55:04.716+0000)

> 
> And no, no one's likely to test this because it would take too long and more effort than it would be worth.

I have never heard of being able to get multiple of the same punishment in a row as long as there's enough space in between instances, and allowing players to ride the edge of toxicity without getting a perma would be very odd indeed.
You're not "riding the edge," though. You don't know when your punishment level de-escalates, and it presumably takes a long time to happen.
